snippet: Niall Ferguson, a Harvard history professor, had suggested that the economist John Maynard Keynes was indifferent to the implications of his theories because he was gay.
abstract: Harvard professor and economics commentator Niall Ferguson issues apology for suggesting that John Maynard Keynes was indifferent to long-term implications of his economic theories because Keynes was gay and had no children
lead_paragraph: Niall Ferguson, a Harvard history professor, had suggested that the economist John Maynard Keynes was indifferent to the implications of his theories because he was gay.

headline.seo: Ferguson of Harvard Apologizes for Remarks on Keynes
